properties.title: Enbridge - Athabasca Pipeline
properties.text1:
Route: Fort McMurray, AB - Hardisty, AB
Capacity: 345,000 bpd
Type of Oil: synthetic and heavy
properties.text2: Enbridge is currently planning the so-called "Athabasca Twinning project that would see a new 36-inch pipe installed along the length of the existing one; the opening of the new line is currently on hold due to the Tar Sands price collapse.

properties.title: Enbridge/BP - Chicap
properties.text1:
Route: Patoka, IL - Manhattan, IL / Mokena, IL - Lemont, IL (Chicago)
Capacity: Manhattan, IL / Mokena, IL - 360,000 bpd; Mokena, IL - Lemont, IL - 100,000 bpd
Type of Oil: light and heavy crude oil, diluent (Patoka to Manhattan)

properties.title: Enbridge Lakehead - Line 6b (now 78)
properties.text1:
Route: Griffith/Hartsdale, IN - Sarnia, ON - Stockbridge, MI - Marysville, MI
Capacity: 500,000 bpd
Type of Oil: Lights Synthetics (Superior to Lockport), Sweet (Superior to Lockport), Light & High Sour
properties.text2: Line 6B produced the worst inland oil spill in US history in 2010. Over 5 years later the cleanup is ongoing.

properties.title: Enbridge Lakehead - Southern Access (Line 61)
properties.text1:
Route: Superior, WI - Flanagan, IL
Capacity: through the addition of extra pumping stations, this 42-inch pipeline has been boosted from 400,000 barrels per day to 1.2 MILLION barrels per day - an unprecedented delivery rate for a crude oil pipeline.
Type of Oil: Lights Synthetics, Sweet, Light & High Sour, Medium, Heavy

properties.text2: This pipeline delivers the most Tar Sands oil to the Midwest
